TrainingDetails.Title: Reference Element
TrainingDetails.BodyCopy:
The Reference element provides a mechanism for creating a page data set based on the Page schema, e.g. pulling in all pages of a certain page type.  Please note that this element type is only visible in the Universal client and is not accessible via the Administrator client.

 The Collapse button shows a sub-set of reference attributes.
 The Expand button shows the complete set of reference attributes.

 The Select button launches the Reference Options Dialog to select pages for the data set.

 

 - allows the user to filter available selections by the initial letters of the selection.

 - adds one or more selected value(s) to the Selected Choices column.

 - removes one or more selected value(s) from the Selected Choices column.

 - moves the selected value up in the order of Selected Choices.

 - moves the selected value down in the order of Selected Choices.

 - lists the first page of available selections.

 - lists the previous page of available selections.

 - lists the available page of available selections by page number.

 - lists the next page of available selections.

 - lists the last page of available selections.

 The OK button commits the selections configured in the Multi Select dialog.

 The Cancel button closes the Multi-Select dialog without populating the Multi Select element.

Page ID – displays the xID of the selected page.
Page Name – displays the name of the selected page.
Include Cross-Reference - determines if the reference between pages goes in both directions provided both pages contain Reference elements.
Depth (Indirect References) – determines the depth of the chained references.

Exports - allows for the entry of an associated attribute to be pulled along with the image into the current page. (also known as local export)

Name - specifies the name of the attribute to be exported with the page to which the element links.
Value - specifies the value of the attribute to be exported with the page to which the element links.

Existing Exports can be removed or additional Exports can be added by selecting the minus/plus buttons respectively.  Notice that Exports consist of a Name/Value pair.
